definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

sentences.chinese: 他们明目张胆地篡改马克思主义。

sentences.english: Resentment flared at such an unmannered intrusion.
sentences.chinese: 对这种明目张胆的入侵感到怒不可遏。

sentences.english: The most flagrant scofflaw of them all is the red-light runner.
sentences.chinese: 最明目张胆的藐视法律行径要算闯红灯了。

sentences.english: How can you lie so glaringly to the poor child?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能对这可怜的孩子这么明目张胆地撒谎？

sentences.english: Golz should be in such obvious communication with the fascists.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔兹竟然和法西斯分子这样明目张胆地勾勾搭搭。

sentences.english: I have never encountered such blat disregard for the Bill of Rights.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有见过这种明目张胆践踏人权法案的现象。

sentences.english: His comments were sometimes blatant, sometimes suggestive, and generally embarrassing.
sentences.chinese: 他的言论有时明目张胆，有时暗示，通常令人很尴尬。

sentences.english: They openly and wantonly carried out repeated armed intrusions into our country.
sentences.chinese: 他们明目张胆地对我国不断发动武装入侵。

definition: (of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open
overt/to make no secret (of one's presence)/grandiose/with great scope
see 冒大不韙|冒大不韪[mao4 da4 bu4 wei3]
pinyin: mao4 tian1 xia4 zhi1 da4 bu4 wei3

definition: to have no sense of shame
the full light of day (idiom)/fig. peace and prosperity/in broad daylight
